name: Legs Up the Wall
setup: Lie back and swing legs up wall
Hips close to wall (or slightly away if hamstrings are tight)
Arms at sides or on belly, palms up
steps: Rest legs against wall, fully relaxed
Let hips and lower back settle into floor
Allow gravity to gently drain legs
mistakes: Forcing hips too close to wall (hamstring strain)
Holding position with effort instead of relaxing
safety: Gentle inversion. Avoid if experiencing vertigo or acute lower back pain. Great for leg recovery after running or basketball.

regressions: Legs elevated on chair or couch (less inversion)
Supine with knees bent, feet on wall
progressions: Supported legs up wall (bolster under hips)
Legs up wall with hip opening (soles of feet together)

prescriptionHints.notes: Hold 5-15 min. Excellent recovery pose for legs, circulation, and nervous system reset.

joints.notes: If hamstrings are tight, move hips slightly away from wall. Completely passive—no muscular effort.
